https_h.help1Txta: HTTPS (Hypertext Transfer Protocol over Secure Socket Layer, or HTTP over SSL) is a web protocol that provides encryption for page requests from users and for the pages returned by the web server. The encrypted exchange of information is governed by the use of an HTTPS certificate, which guarantees the authenticity of the server.
https_h.help1Txtb: The Secure Socket Layer (SSL) as used by HTTPS uses a 40-bit key size for encryption, a level considered adequate for most commercial exchanges.
https_h.help2Txt: To use HTTPS on the Axis product, an HTTPS certificate must be installed. Go to System Options > Security > Certificates to create and install certificates.
https_h.note_Txt: Note that viewing encrypted web pages via HTTPS is almost certain to cause a slight drop in performance, especially when requesting a page for the first time.
https_h.help3Txta: To enable HTTPS on the Axis product, select an HTTPS certificate from the list of installed certificates.
https_h.help3Txtb: Optionally, click Ciphers and select the ciphers to use with the certificate.
https_h.help4Txta: The HTTPS connection policy defines the protocol(s) that can be used by different user groups. The options are to use either HTTP or HTTPS only, or to use both.
https_h.help4Txtc: To access the Axis product via the desired protocol, enter https://... or http://... in the address field in a browser. If using both protocols, switching from one to the other is allowed, and no other changes are required.
https_h.help4Txtd: Note: The connection policy is only available if a valid HTTPS certificate is selected. If the certificate is removed, or if no certificate is selected, the connection policy will automatically return to the default value, i.e. HTTP.

https_create_cert_h.help1Txt1: To create a self-signed HTTPS certificate or a certificate request, provide the information listed below:
https_create_cert_h.help1Txt2: Country - Use a 2-letter combination to denote the country the certificate will be used in. The letter combination must be according to the standard ISO 3166. For example, the code for the United States is US. For the full list of country codes, please visit the web site of the International Organisation for Standardization.
https_create_cert_h.help1Txt3: State or province - The local administrative region.
https_create_cert_h.help1Txt5: Organization - The name of the organization to which the entity identified in 'common name' belongs.
https_create_cert_h.help1Txt6: Organizational unit - The name of the organizational unit to which the entity identified in 'common name' belongs (e.g Finance Department)
https_create_cert_h.help1Txt7: Common name - Denotes the name of the person or other entity that the certificate identifies (often used to identify the web site)
https_create_cert_h.help1Txt8: Validity (only when creating a self-signed certificate) - this period in days defines how long the certificate will be valid for.
